_header: The proverbs of Solomon do plainly declare
_description: Proverbs attributed to Solomon — twenty-three stanzas ottava rima

HunHM183.First Lines:
The proverbes of Salmon do playnly declareThat wysdome ys the
                    vessell that longest will endure…
HunHM183.Last Lines:
…When thowe spekest let men marvell at thy shamefacenesWhen
                    thow spekest not let them wondre at thy sobernes
HunHM183.Note:
Ends, ‘Withe leavinge honour to women I ende quod Bryan’ (f.
                    9); written by a hand of the sixteenth century.
HunHM183.Editions:
Kinsman,  Robert S. 
             “‘The Proverbes of Salmon Do Playnly Declare’: a Sententious
                Poem on Wisdom and Governance, Ascribed to Sir Francis Bryan.” 
             Huntington Library Quarterly
         42 (1978-79): 279-312: 279-312.
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 253.
